jobs.title: Medical Operations Lead - Denmark
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Build something monumental for Healthcare!

At Tandem Health we’re reimagining healthcare by putting clinicians first. Our platform - designed by clinicians, for clinicians - is built on deep insight into real-world pain points, with intuitive medical notes and workflows that truly support patient care.

We’re a fast-scaling health-tech company backed by top investors and expanding globally. We move fast, stay curious, and believe building something that matters starts with an extraordinary team. If you're passionate about impact and innovation, we'd love to meet you!

About the Role

We’re seeking a Medical Operations Lead to play a pivotal role in the adoption, growth, and strategic integration of Tandem’s solutions across healthcare settings in Denmark. This is a unique opportunity for a clinically grounded leader to sit at the intersection of operations, product, and customer success - driving forward our mission to transform how healthcare professionals work. 

As a senior member of our Medical Operations team, you'll lead deployments of Tandem’s AI medical assistant technology into clinical environments, ensuring that each implementation is not only successful but becomes a model for scalable excellence. You’ll work closely with our product, commercial, and clinical teams to evolve how we roll out, iterate, and embed Tandem in daily clinical practice. 

What You Will Do

  • Lead the implementation and scaling of Tandem’s AI clinical assistant technology together with our partners, across healthcare sites in Denmark, ensuring excellence in execution and impact. 

  • Own onboarding and training processes - coaching and mentoring clinicians to become power users and advocates for Tandem. 

  • Drive strategy for product adoption by synthesising user feedback, identifying operational challenges, and shaping internal priorities. 

  • Collaborate cross-functionally with product, engineering, and commercial teams to integrate clinical insights into roadmap planning and delivery. 

  • Build credibility within the clinical community by engaging key opinion leaders, speaking at industry events, and leading by example. 

  • Mentor and support junior members of the Medical Operations team as we continue to grow. 


What You Bring

  • Clinical background with significant operational or implementation experience  

  • Proven ability to lead projects or teams in fast-paced, interdisciplinary settings. 

  • Passion for digital health and a vision for how technology can enhance clinical care. 

  • Strong communication and stakeholder management skills. 

  • A proactive mindset with a strong sense of ownership and initiative. 

  • Comfort working both strategically and hands-on in a dynamic, startup environment. 

Bonus Points

  • Experience in health-tech or leading change initiatives in healthcare. 

  • A background in scaling operational systems or managing complex stakeholder networks. 

  • Familiarity with large language models (LLMs) or AI-driven medical tools. 


Location

We believe the best ideas happen when we’re together. This is a full-time role based in either Denmark or Stockholm. While your primary focus will be on Denmark implementations, you’ll also collaborate closely with our Stockholm-based team.  Travel is expected locally to meet customers, and regular trips to Stockholm to meet the full team are also a requirement.

How to Apply

We adopt a continuous selection process, so please make sure to apply with your CV in English.

Our interview process consists of 4 stages:

  1. Screening interview with Talent Acquisition

  2. First interview with our Country Manager

  3. Follow up interview with our CEO or CCO

  4. Working Day - Join us in the Stockholm office for a day to experience our culture firsthand, collaborate with our team, and see how you work in action.

Culture at Tandem

At Tandem, we move fast, think big, and take ownership. We're a high-performing, diverse team with a shared drive to change the future of healthcare - and we’re just getting started.

Our culture is built on action, ambition, and learning. You'll be trusted to take the lead, challenge yourself, and make an impact from day one. We believe real growth happens when you're stretched, supported, and surrounded by smart, passionate teammates who want to win together.

Even though we’re spread across countries, we come together often in Sweden for team meetings, social events, and offsites - blending global reach with real human connection.

We hire for talent, potential, and attitude - valuing different backgrounds and fresh perspectives. Great ideas come from everywhere, and we’re building a team that reflects the world we want to change.

jobs.title: AI Engineer - Stockholm
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Build something monumental for Healthcare!

At Tandem Health we’re reimagining healthcare by putting clinicians first. Our platform - designed by clinicians, for clinicians - is built on deep insight into real-world pain points, with intuitive medical notes and workflows that truly support patient care.

We’re a fast-scaling health-tech company backed by top investors and expanding globally. We move fast, stay curious, and believe building something that matters starts with an extraordinary team. If you're passionate about impact and innovation, we'd love to meet you!


About the Role

We're looking for an experienced and passionate AI Engineer to join us in building a cutting-edge, LLM-centered application that will transform the healthcare experience in Europe. This is an opportunity to work at the intersection of advanced AI, intuitive design, and real-world impact — all in a fast-paced startup environment where the best ideas win. You'll be part of a world-class team shaping the future of healthcare delivery with powerful, production-grade LLM technology.

What You Will Do

  • Design and build a full-stack, LLM-driven application — from intuitive UI to seamless backend model integration

  • Monitor and improve a highly utilized LLM application already in production

  • Iterate quickly to incorporate the latest advancements in LLMs, infrastructure, and user feedback into the product

  • Own the end-to-end delivery of features and solutions, from idea to deployment

  • Work cross-functionally with product, design, and engineering to drive real user outcomes

What You Bring

  • A strong background in AI engineering, especially with LLM-centric products

  • Proven experience shipping production-grade applications, ideally in fast-paced or startup environments

  • A bias toward action, comfort with ambiguity, and a passion for tackling complex problems

  • A collaborative spirit — you're excited to work with top-tier teammates and contribute to a culture where the best ideas thrive

  • Experience with our core stack: Python, TypeScript, React, Kubernetes

  • Motivation to help reshape European healthcare, and enjoy the journey while doing it

Bonus Points

  • Familiarity with Microsoft-based infrastructure: C# for Windows apps, Azure for cloud hosting

  • Hands-on experience using or integrating LLMs like GPT or speech models like Whisper

  • Prior work in healthcare tech or regulated environments

Location

We believe the best ideas happen when we’re together. This role is based in our vibrant HQ in the Epicenter building in the heart of Stockholm where you will work primarily from our office to collaborate, connect, and build our culture.

How to Apply

We adopt a continuous selection process, so please make sure to apply with your CV in English.

Our interview process consists of 4 stages:

  1. Screening interview with Talent Acquisition

  2. First interview with our CTO & Co-Founder

  3. Follow up technical interview with some of our Engineering team

  4. Working Day - Join us in the Stockholm office for a day to experience our culture firsthand, collaborate with our team, and see how you work in action.


Benefits

  • Competitive salary & company stock options

  • 25 days/year of paid vacation

  • 5,000 SEK wellness allowance (friskvårdsbidrag)

  • Social and team-building activities (off-sites, after works, winter/summer parties)

  • An opportunity to make a real positive impact in the world of healthcare

  • Work with some of the best minds in AI, healthcare, and engineering.

We review our benefits packages on a regular basis and might modify our benefits from time to time.

Culture at Tandem

At Tandem, we move fast, think big, and take ownership. We're a high-performing, diverse team with a shared drive to change the future of healthcare - and we’re just getting started.

Our culture is built on action, ambition, and learning. You'll be trusted to take the lead, challenge yourself, and make an impact from day one. We believe real growth happens when you're stretched, supported, and surrounded by smart, passionate teammates who want to win together.

Even though we’re spread across countries, we come together often in Sweden for team meetings, social events, and offsites - blending global reach with real human connection.

We hire for talent, potential, and attitude - valuing different backgrounds and fresh perspectives. Great ideas come from everywhere, and we’re building a team that reflects the world we want to change.

jobs.title: Commercial Partnerships - France
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Build something monumental for Healthcare!

At Tandem Health we’re reimagining healthcare by putting clinicians first. Our platform - designed by clinicians, for clinicians - is built on deep insight into real-world pain points, with intuitive medical notes and workflows that truly support patient care.

We’re a fast-scaling health-tech company backed by top investors and expanding globally. We move fast, stay curious, and believe building something that matters starts with an extraordinary team. If you're passionate about impact and innovation, we'd love to meet you!

About the Role

We’re looking for a Commercial Partnerships Manager to grow our footprint across France. You’ll be at the forefront of introducing Tandem’s clinician copilot to providers, partners, and health systems - shaping how we scale across France

This is a pivotal role where you’ll forge high-impact partnerships across the care ecosystem, from provider networks and EHR vendors to resellers and health insurers. You’ll act as a market expert, relationship builder, and operator all in one.

What you will do

  • Identify, initiate, and manage key relationships across the healthcare landscape in France.

  • Open doors with provider groups, EHR vendors, system integrators, payors, and commercial resellers to accelerate Tandem’s reach and adoption.

  • Pitch, negotiate, and close deals that deliver strategic value, working closely with legal, product, and commercial teams to get contracts across the line.

  • Represent Tandem externally in meetings, events, and conferences, positioning us as a trusted digital health partner.

  • Bring the voice of the market back into Tandem, sharing insights that inform product development, regulatory priorities, and local go-to-market strategy.

  • Help build the customer success and support infrastructure that ensures our partners thrive with Tandem.

What You Bring

  • Proven experience with healthcare partnerships, sales, or business development - ideally in health-tech, med-tech, or SaaS companies.

  • A strong track record of closing strategic partnerships in complex, regulated environments with providers, EHRs, or pharmaceutical companies.

  • Deep knowledge of the French healthcare ecosystem - from payors and providers to health IT vendors and regional nuances.

  • A strong local network and ability to build trusted relationships across stakeholder groups.

  • Comfortable navigating clinical, commercial, and technical conversations.

  • Fluent in French and English, with excellent communication skills.

  • Independent operator with the ability to collaborate closely with cross-functional teams.

  • Passion for improving healthcare delivery through thoughtful, impactful innovation.

Bonus Points

  • Experience working with or selling into EHR providers, health systems, or care delivery platforms.

  • Background in medtech, digital health, or regulated software.

  • Familiarity with EU/French regulatory and compliance environments.

  • Experience in startup or high-growth environments, especially launching new markets.


Location

We believe the best ideas happen when we’re together. This is a full-time role based in France. You’ll travel regularly - either to meet clinicians around France or to collaborate with our team in Stockholm.


How to Apply

We adopt a continuous selection process, so please make sure to apply with your CV in English.

Our interview process consists of 4 stages:

  1. Screening interview with Talent Acquisition

  2. First interview with our Country Director in France

  3. Follow up interview with our CCO & Co-Founder

  4. Working Day - Join us in the Stockholm office for a day to experience our culture firsthand, collaborate with our team, and see how you work in action.

Culture at Tandem

At Tandem, we move fast, think big, and take ownership. We're a high-performing, diverse team with a shared drive to change the future of healthcare - and we’re just getting started.

Our culture is built on action, ambition, and learning. You'll be trusted to take the lead, challenge yourself, and make an impact from day one. We believe real growth happens when you're stretched, supported, and surrounded by smart, passionate teammates who want to win together.

Even though we’re spread across countries, we come together often in Sweden for team meetings, social events, and offsites - blending global reach with real human connection.

We hire for talent, potential, and attitude - valuing different backgrounds and fresh perspectives. Great ideas come from everywhere, and we’re building a team that reflects the world we want to change.

jobs.title: Medical Operations - Global
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Build something monumental for Healthcare!

At Tandem Health we’re reimagining healthcare by putting clinicians first. Our platform - designed by clinicians, for clinicians - is built on deep insight into real-world pain points, with intuitive medical notes and workflows that truly support patient care.

We’re a fast-scaling health-tech company backed by top investors and expanding globally. We move fast, stay curious, and believe building something that matters starts with an extraordinary team. If you're passionate about impact and innovation, we'd love to meet you!

About the Role

We’re building the clinical co-pilot of the future - empowering clinicians, enhancing care delivery, and scaling impact. As part of our Global Medical Operations team, you’ll play a pivotal role in rolling out Tandem’s AI clinical operating system to some of the most influential healthcare organisations worldwide.

This is a highly visible, global role where you’ll engage directly with executives, medical leaders, and end-users. You’ll bring clinical insight into how our tools are implemented on the ground - from onboarding new organisations and refining workflows to shaping the product through continuous feedback. You’ll be at the forefront of transforming healthcare delivery, ensuring Tandem becomes an indispensable part of daily patient care for clinicians across the globe.

What You Will Do

  • Lead live product demos for prospective clients and support global commercial efforts.

  • Design and adapt workflows and templates for diverse markets and large-scale customers.

  • Partner with product, engineering, and commercial teams to deliver smooth rollouts and seamless workflow integration.

  • Represent Tandem at international conferences, workshops, and customer events.

  • Guide clinicians through onboarding, training, and day-to-day support.

  • Troubleshoot and solve problems to ensure clinicians get maximum value from Tandem.

  • Build templates and prompts, contributing to the ongoing evolution of Tandem’s AI assistant.

  • Manage clinical safety incidents and optimise internal operations for safe scaling.


What You Bring

  • Clinical experience in healthcare (e.g. general practice, hospital, private practice).

  • Exposure to consulting, corporate, or startup environments.

  • A passion for technology, AI, and their potential to transform care.

  • Strong communication skills — equally comfortable with executives, engineers, and frontline clinicians.

  • Organisational strength and a process-driven mindset.

  • Ownership, curiosity, and initiative in a fast-paced environment.

  • Flexibility to travel up to 25% and step in during critical moments.

  • Multilingual skills (highly valued).

Bonus Points

  • Experience with prompting or large language models (LLMs).

  • Background in healthtech or SaaS.

  • Familiarity with EU clinical safety or digital health regulations.

  • Track record in implementation projects or customer rollouts.

Location

We believe the best ideas happen when we’re together. This role is based in our vibrant HQ in the Epicenter building in the heart of Stockholm where you will work primarily from our office to collaborate, connect, and build our culture.

How to Apply

We adopt a continuous selection process, so please make sure to apply with your CV in English.

Our interview process consists of 4 stages:

  1. Screening interview with Talent Acquisition

  2. First interview with our Country Director

  3. Follow up interview with some of our Medical Operations team members

  4. Working Day - Join us in the Stockholm office for a day to experience our culture firsthand, collaborate with our team, and see how you work in action.


Benefits

  • Competitive salary & company stock options

  • 25 days/year of paid vacation

  • 5,000 SEK wellness allowance (friskvårdsbidrag)

  • Social and team-building activities (off-sites, after works, winter/summer parties)

  • An opportunity to make a real positive impact in the world of healthcare

  • Work with some of the best minds in AI, healthcare, and engineering.

We review our benefits packages on a regular basis and might modify our benefits from time to time.

Culture at Tandem

At Tandem, we move fast, think big, and take ownership. We're a high-performing, diverse team with a shared drive to change the future of healthcare - and we’re just getting started.

Our culture is built on action, ambition, and learning. You'll be trusted to take the lead, challenge yourself, and make an impact from day one. We believe real growth happens when you're stretched, supported, and surrounded by smart, passionate teammates who want to win together.

Even though we’re spread across countries, we come together often in Sweden for team meetings, social events, and offsites - blending global reach with real human connection.

We hire for talent, potential, and attitude - valuing different backgrounds and fresh perspectives. Great ideas come from everywhere, and we’re building a team that reflects the world we want to change.

 - Social and team-building activities (off-sites, after works, winter/summer parties)

 - An opportunity to make a real positive impact in the world of healthcare

 - Work with some of the best minds in AI, healthcare, and engineering.

We review our benefits packages on a regular basis and might modify our benefits from time to time.


CULTURE AT TANDEM


At Tandem, we move fast, think big, and take ownership. We're a high-performing, diverse team with a shared drive to change the future of healthcare - and we’re just getting started.

Our culture is built on action, ambition, and learning. You'll be trusted to take the lead, challenge yourself, and make an impact from day one. We believe real growth happens when you're stretched, supported, and surrounded by smart, passionate teammates who want to win together.

Even though we’re spread across countries, we come together often in Sweden for team meetings, social events, and offsites - blending global reach with real human connection.

We hire for talent, potential, and attitude - valuing different backgrounds and fresh perspectives. Great ideas come from everywhere, and we’re building a team that reflects the world we want to change.

jobs.title: Open Application
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Build something monumental for Healthcare!

At Tandem Health we’re reimagining healthcare by putting clinicians first. Our platform - designed by clinicians, for clinicians - is built on deep insight into real-world pain points, with intuitive medical notes and workflows that truly support patient care.

We’re a fast-scaling health-tech company backed by top investors and expanding globally. We move fast, stay curious, and believe building something that matters starts with an extraordinary team. If you're passionate about impact and innovation, we'd love to meet you!

🚀 Don’t see a role that fits? We’d still love to hear from you 🚀


At Tandem, we’re growing quickly - and we know that sometimes the best people don’t fit neatly into a job description. If you’re excited about our mission and believe your skills and experience could make a meaningful impact here, we’d love for you to tell us why.

jobs.title: Country Director - Portugal
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Build something monumental for Healthcare!

At Tandem Health we’re reimagining healthcare by putting clinicians first. Our platform - designed by clinicians, for clinicians - is built on deep insight into real-world pain points, with intuitive medical notes and workflows that truly support patient care.

We’re a fast-scaling health-tech company backed by top investors and expanding globally. We move fast, stay curious, and believe building something that matters starts with an extraordinary team. If you're passionate about impact and innovation, we'd love to meet you!


About the Role

At Tandem we’re reimagining how clinicians deliver care. As Country Director for Portugal, you’ll lead our market entry - shaping strategy, building partnerships, and bringing our clinician co-pilot to care providers across the country.

You'll work closely with our commercial and product teams to tailor Tandem for Portugal's healthcare system, making a real difference in clinical workflows. As we grow, you’ll build and lead a local team to scale our impact quickly and sustainably

What you will do

  • Own the strategy and execution to launch and grow Tandem in Portugal.

  • Build partnerships with providers, payors, and system suppliers (e.g., EHR vendors).

  • Work with our product team to localize Tandem’s solution for Portuguese clinicians.

  • Assemble and lead a high-performing local team as traction builds.

  • Champion the voice of the Portuguese market within Tandem.

What you bring

  • Extensive experience within healthcare, either clinical, commercial, or both.

  • A strong understanding of the Portuguese healthcare landscape.

  • Proven leadership and entrepreneurial drive - you know how to build from the ground up.

  • A collaborative mindset and passion for user-centered innovation.

  • Passion, resilience, and a deep commitment to improving healthcare.

Bonus Points

  • A strong network across Portugal's healthcare sector.

  • Health-tech go-to-market experience.

  • Familiarity with Portuguese healthcare regulations.

  • Fluency in Portuguese and English.

Location

We believe the best ideas happen when we’re together. This is a full-time role based remotely in Lisbon. You’ll travel regularly - either to meet clinicians around Portugal or to collaborate with our team in Stockholm.


How to Apply

We adopt a continuous selection process, so please make sure to apply with your CV in English.

Our interview process consists of 4 stages:

  1. Screening interview with Talent Acquisition

  2. First interview with our CCO & Co-Founder

  3. Follow up interview with our CEO & Co-Founder

  4. Working Day - Join us in the Stockholm office for a day to experience our culture firsthand, collaborate with our team, and see how you work in action.

We hire for talent, potential, and attitude - valuing different backgrounds and fresh perspectives. Great ideas come from everywhere, and we’re building a team that reflects the world we want to change.

jobs.title: Product Engineer - Stockholm
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Build something monumental for Healthcare!

At Tandem Health we’re reimagining healthcare by putting clinicians first. Our platform - designed by clinicians, for clinicians - is built on deep insight into real-world pain points, with intuitive medical notes and workflows that truly support patient care.

We’re a fast-scaling health-tech company backed by top investors and expanding globally. We move fast, stay curious, and believe building something that matters starts with an extraordinary team. If you're passionate about impact and innovation, we'd love to meet you!

About the Role

You love building products that truly delight at light speed. At your previous job you often felt impatient that your team’s next wave of improvements isn’t in your users' hands already. At Tandem you’ll be using that mindset to solve the problem that today clinicians are forced to work in systems that work against them rather than with them.

As a Product Engineer at Tandem you’ll be shaping and building towards our product vision, working closely with designers, other engineers and our users. Owning and shipping features end to end, from understanding the user's pain-point through shipping it to clinicians all over Europe and polishing it to delight our users. You’re deeply technical, but ultimately, you’re motivated by crafting great products that solve real problems, and you’ll roll up your sleeves and get that done.


What you will do:

  • Own Product development end-to-end by defining product requirements, setting priorities, and translating ideas into technical specifications

  • Partner directly with designers, users, and other engineers to shape and deliver impactful features.

  • Design and implement scalable web applications using modern front-end and back-end technologies.

  • Ensure applications provide an intuitive and seamless user experience, incorporating feedback from stakeholders and end-users.

  • Maintain high standards of code quality through code reviews, testing, and documentation.

  • Use the best modern tools to ship great features as fast as possible.

What You Bring

  • A strong product mindset with the ability to define, build, and ship impactful features end-to-end.

  • Proven experience building and deploying production-grade  Python  systems.

  • Strong programming skills in TypeScript and  React.

  • Experience with cloud infrastructure and a focus on scalability and reliability

  • A passion for technical excellence and a drive to deliver impactful solutions.

  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills.

Bonus Points

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.

  • Experience in the healthcare industry or with health-related applications

  • Experience building Large Language Model (LLM) applications.

  • Experience handling streaming audio and transcription.

  • Experience with Kubernetes and Azure

Location

We believe the best ideas happen when we’re together. This role is based in our vibrant HQ in the Epicenter building in the heart of Stockholm where you will work primarily from our office to collaborate, connect, and build our culture.


How to Apply

We adopt a continuous selection process, so please make sure to apply with your CV in English.

Our interview process consists of 4 stages:

  1. Screening interview with Talent Acquisition

  2. Technical interviews with some of our Engineers

  3. Interview with our CTO & Co-Founder

  4. Working Day - Join us in the Stockholm office for a day to experience our our culture firsthand, collaborate with our team, and see how you work in action.


Benefits

  • Competitive salary & company stock options

  • 25 days/year of paid vacation

  • 5,000 SEK wellness allowance (friskvårdsbidrag)

  • Social and team-building activities (off-sites, after works, winter/summer parties)

  • An opportunity to make a real positive impact in the world of healthcare

  • Work with some of the best minds in AI, healthcare, and engineering.

We review our benefits packages on a regular basis and might modify our benefits from time to time.

Culture at Tandem

At Tandem, we move fast, think big, and take ownership. We're a high-performing, diverse team with a shared drive to change the future of healthcare - and we’re just getting started.

Our culture is built on action, ambition, and learning. You'll be trusted to take the lead, challenge yourself, and make an impact from day one. We believe real growth happens when you're stretched, supported, and surrounded by smart, passionate teammates who want to win together.

Even though we’re spread across countries, we come together often in Sweden for team meetings, social events, and offsites - blending global reach with real human connection.

We hire for talent, potential, and attitude - valuing different backgrounds and fresh perspectives. Great ideas come from everywhere, and we’re building a team that reflects the world we want to change.

jobs.title: Staff Engineer - Stockholm
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Build something monumental for Healthcare!

At Tandem Health we’re reimagining healthcare by putting clinicians first. Our platform - designed by clinicians, for clinicians - is built on deep insight into real-world pain points, with intuitive medical notes and workflows that truly support patient care.

We’re a fast-scaling health-tech company backed by top investors and expanding globally. We move fast, stay curious, and believe building something that matters starts with an extraordinary team. If you're passionate about impact and innovation, we'd love to meet you!

About the Role

You love solving problems with technology. At your previous job you were the person who really got stuff done, and because you understood how everything worked you were the person people came to for help. At Tandem those skills will be applied to problems that really matter, problems that ensure our healthcare system is functioning properly. You’ll be designing, implementing, & debugging high stakes complex systems together with other people who are locked in and passionate about both our mission and technology.

You’ll work across the stack and across teams, setting the technical direction, mentoring others, and ensuring our systems are performant, reliable, and continuously improving.


This is a high-impact role where you'll shape both the product and the engineering culture. You’ll be responsible not just for writing excellent code, but also for identifying the right problems to solve and driving initiatives from conception to deployment. If you're excited by the opportunity to influence product direction while solving deep technical challenges, we'd love to meet you!


What you will do:

  • Lead the design and development of complex systems - from data processing pipelines to APIs and client integrations that are critical to clinician workflows.

  • Architect and scale cloud infrastructure to ensure high availability, performance, and security.

  • Set technical direction and standards through hands-on work, thoughtful design, and clear documentation.

  • Collaborate closely with stakeholders, including clinicians and designers, to ensure we're solving the right problems with the right solutions.

  • Guide technical decisions across backend and frontend systems, including Python, TypeScript, React, and Kubernetes.

  • Mentor and support engineers across the team through code reviews, design feedback, and strategic guidance.

  • Drive a culture of continuous improvement in engineering practices, tooling, and code quality.

What You Bring

  • A track record of leading technical projects end-to-end in a fast-moving product environment. 

  • Deep experience building and deploying scalable backend systems. 

  • Expertise in cloud infrastructure and distributed systems. A strong product mindset - you care about impact, not just code. 

  • A bias toward ownership, proactivity, and collaboration. 

  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to influence engineering and product decisions. 

Bonus Points

  • Hands-on experience with LLM-based applications. 

  • Experience working with streaming audio, transcription systems, or real-time media pipelines. 

  • Experience building authentication servers and systems. 

  • Experience with Kubernetes and Azure 

  • Open-source contributions or thought leadership within engineering communities. 

  • Experience in health-tech, including designing FHIR/HL7 compliant systems. 

  • Proficiency with modern frontend technologies, especially TypeScript and React. 

Location

We believe the best ideas happen when we’re together. This role is based in our vibrant HQ in the Epicenter building in the heart of Stockholm where you will work primarily from our office to collaborate, connect, and build our culture.


How to Apply

We adopt a continuous selection process, so please make sure to apply with your CV in English.

Our interview process consists of 4 stages:

  1. Screening interview with Talent Acquisition

  2. Technical interviews with some of our Engineers

  3. Interview with our CTO & Co-Founder

  4. Working Day - Join us in the Stockholm office for a day to experience our our culture firsthand, collaborate with our team, and see how you work in action.


Benefits

  • Competitive salary & company stock options

  • 25 days/year of paid vacation

  • 5,000 SEK wellness allowance (friskvårdsbidrag)

  • Social and team-building activities (off-sites, after works, winter/summer parties)

  • An opportunity to make a real positive impact in the world of healthcare

  • Work with some of the best minds in AI, healthcare, and engineering.

We review our benefits packages on a regular basis and might modify our benefits from time to time.

jobs.title: Staff Engineer - Authentication
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Build something monumental for Healthcare!

At Tandem Health we’re reimagining healthcare by putting clinicians first. Our platform - designed by clinicians, for clinicians - is built on deep insight into real-world pain points, with intuitive medical notes and workflows that truly support patient care.

We’re a fast-scaling health-tech company backed by top investors and expanding globally. We move fast, stay curious, and believe building something that matters starts with an extraordinary team. If you're passionate about impact and innovation, we'd love to meet you!

About the Role & You

You’re a deeply curious person and that curiosity has led you deep into the world of authentication and identity. You care profoundly about how people prove who they are on the internet, how systems decide who gets access to what, and how we can make those decisions seamlessly and securely.

Over the years, you’ve worked with a wide variety of authentication methods, identity frameworks, and security standards. You’ve seen the tradeoffs of different approaches firsthand and learned how to design systems that balance security, usability, and scalability. At your previous companies, people came to you when they wanted to understand how authentication actually works under the hood.

At Tandem, you’ll lead the effort to build secure, robust, and user-friendly authentication systems that power the next generation of healthcare products. You’ll define the technical direction, set standards, and design core identity infrastructure - enabling safe, seamless access for clinicians and patients across all European countries.

This is a high-impact role where you’ll shape both the product and our engineering culture. If you’re excited by the challenge of building authentication systems that people can trust and doing it at the scale and safety level healthcare demands we’d love to meet you.

What You Will Do

  • Lead the design and development of our authentication and identity systems - from foundational protocols to user-facing access flows that are critical to clinician and patient trust.

  • Define and implement robust authorization frameworks, ensuring users only access the data and functionality they are entitled to, while keeping the experience seamless.

  • Evaluate and integrate industry standards and authentication technologies, understanding the tradeoffs to select the right approach for each use case.

  • Build systems that scale securely, enabling safe and reliable identity management as our products grow to support healthcare organizations and their preferred Identity Providers across Europe..

  • Serve as the go-to expert on authentication, helping others understand how identity systems work under the hood and driving best practices across the company.

  • Set the technical direction for our identity and security efforts, mentoring engineers and fostering a culture of security, reliability, and technical excellence.

What You Bring

  • A proven track record of designing and implementing secure authentication and authorization systems in production environments.

  • Deep experience with industry standards and identity frameworks (e.g. OAuth 2.0, OpenID Connect, SAML, or similar) and a clear understanding of their tradeoffs.

  • The ability to build systems that remain secure, performant, and reliable at scale, including rolling out authentication stacks to large user bases.

  • A passion for digital identity and a deep curiosity for how systems work under the hood, you want to understand, not just use, the technology.

  • Strong communication skills, with the ability to collaborate closely with engineering, product, and security stakeholders across the organization.

  • A bias toward ownership, proactivity, and collaboration, you take responsibility for outcomes and raise the bar for everyone around you.

Bonus Points

  • Strong experience building SSO integrations across diverse providers, and a clear vision for how to unify identity across multiple countries and healthcare partners.

  • Prior work in healthcare tech or regulated environments.

  • Deep understanding of clinical workflows, EHR systems, and medical documentation processes.

Location

We believe the best ideas happen when we’re together. This role is based in our vibrant HQ in the Epicenter building in the heart of Stockholm where you will work primarily from our office to collaborate, connect, and build our culture.

How to Apply

We adopt a continuous selection process, so please make sure to apply with your CV in English.

Our interview process consists of 4 stages:

  1. Screening interview with Talent Acquisition

  2. Shorter technical interview with one of senior engineers

  3. Follow up technical interview with some of our Engineering team

  4. First interview with our CTO & Co-Founder

  5. Working Day - Join us in the Stockholm office for a day to experience our culture firsthand, collaborate with our team, and see how you work in action.


Benefits

  • Competitive salary & company stock options

  • 25 days/year of paid vacation

  • 5,000 SEK wellness allowance (friskvårdsbidrag)

  • Social and team-building activities (off-sites, after works, winter/summer parties)

  • An opportunity to make a real positive impact in the world of healthcare

  • Work with some of the best minds in AI, healthcare, and engineering.

We review our benefits packages on a regular basis and might modify our benefits from time to time.

Culture at Tandem

At Tandem, we move fast, think big, and take ownership. We're a high-performing, diverse team with a shared drive to change the future of healthcare - and we’re just getting started.

Our culture is built on action, ambition, and learning. You'll be trusted to take the lead, challenge yourself, and make an impact from day one. We believe real growth happens when you're stretched, supported, and surrounded by smart, passionate teammates who want to win together.

Even though we’re spread across countries, we come together often in Sweden for team meetings, social events, and offsites - blending global reach with real human connection.

We hire for talent, potential, and attitude - valuing different backgrounds and fresh perspectives. Great ideas come from everywhere, and we’re building a team that reflects the world we want to change.

jobs.title: Medical Operations - Stockholm
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Build something monumental for Healthcare!

At Tandem Health we’re reimagining healthcare by putting clinicians first. Our platform - designed by clinicians, for clinicians - is built on deep insight into real-world pain points, with intuitive medical notes and workflows that truly support patient care.

We’re a fast-scaling health-tech company backed by top investors and expanding globally. We move fast, stay curious, and believe building something that matters starts with an extraordinary team. If you're passionate about impact and innovation, we'd love to meet you!

About the Role

At Tandem Health, we're building the clinical co-pilot of the future - one that empowers clinicians, enhances care delivery, and scales impact. As part of our Medical Operations team, you’ll play a pivotal role in ensuring that Tandem is successfully adopted across Sweden.

You’ll work at the intersection of medicine and technology, bringing clinical insight into how our tools are implemented in real-world clinical settings. From onboarding new users to refining workflows and sharing feedback with the product team, you’ll help ensure Tandem fits seamlessly into the daily realities of patient care.

This is a unique opportunity to be part of a mission-driven team transforming healthcare at scale - and to shape how clinicians across Sweden experience and benefit from next-generation tools.

What You Will Do

  • Guide clinicians through onboarding, training, and day-to-day support via tools like Intercom.

  • Ensure clinicians are getting the most out of Tandem, solving problems and gathering feedback for continuous improvement.

  • Build templates and prompts, and contribute to ongoing refinement of Tandem’s AI assistant.

  • Run live product demos for prospective clients and support commercial efforts.

  • Log and manage clinical safety incidents and optimise internal operations to scale safely.

  • Work closely with product, engineering, and commercial teams to ensure smooth rollout and workflow integration.

  • Represent Tandem at conferences, events, and workshops, sharing our vision with clinicians and stakeholders.


What You Bring

  • Clinical experience in a healthcare setting (e.g. general practice, private practice, hospital roles).

  • Some experience in consulting, corporate, or startup environments.

  • A passion for technology, AI, and its potential to transform healthcare.

  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills - comfortable working with clinicians, engineers, and commercial teams.

  • Strong organisational skills and a process-driven mindset.

  • A strong sense of ownership and initiative coupled with a proactive and curious approach

  • Willingness to work flexibly, travel as needed, and step up during critical moments.

  • Fluency in Swedish, with the ability to engage confidently with local stakeholders

Bonus Points

  • Familiarity with prompting and large language models (LLMs).

  • Experience working in a healthtech or SaaS company.

  • Exposure to regulatory standards in the EU (e.g. clinical safety, digital health compliance).

  • Experience running implementation projects or customer-facing rollouts.

Location

We believe the best ideas happen when we’re together. This role is based in our vibrant HQ in the Epicenter building in the heart of Stockholm where you will work primarily from our office to collaborate, connect, and build our culture.

How to Apply

We adopt a continuous selection process, so please make sure to apply with your CV in English.

Our interview process consists of 4 stages:

  1. Screening interview with Talent Acquisition

  2. First interview with our Country Manager

  3. Follow up interview with some of our Medical Operations team members

  4. Working Day - Join us in the Stockholm office for a day to experience our culture firsthand, collaborate with our team, and see how you work in action.


Benefits

  • Competitive salary & company stock options

  • 25 days/year of paid vacation

  • 5,000 SEK wellness allowance (friskvårdsbidrag)

  • Social and team-building activities (off-sites, after works, winter/summer parties)

  • An opportunity to make a real positive impact in the world of healthcare

  • Work with some of the best minds in AI, healthcare, and engineering.

We review our benefits packages on a regular basis and might modify our benefits from time to time.

Culture at Tandem

At Tandem, we move fast, think big, and take ownership. We're a high-performing, diverse team with a shared drive to change the future of healthcare - and we’re just getting started.

Our culture is built on action, ambition, and learning. You'll be trusted to take the lead, challenge yourself, and make an impact from day one. We believe real growth happens when you're stretched, supported, and surrounded by smart, passionate teammates who want to win together.

Even though we’re spread across countries, we come together often in Sweden for team meetings, social events, and offsites - blending global reach with real human connection.

We hire for talent, potential, and attitude - valuing different backgrounds and fresh perspectives. Great ideas come from everywhere, and we’re building a team that reflects the world we want to change.

jobs.title: Forward Deployed Windows Engineer - Stockholm
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Build something monumental for Healthcare!

At Tandem Health we’re reimagining healthcare by putting clinicians first. Our platform - designed by clinicians, for clinicians - is built on deep insight into real-world pain points, with intuitive medical notes and workflows that truly support patient care.

We’re a fast-scaling health-tech company backed by top investors and expanding globally. We move fast, stay curious, and believe building something that matters starts with an extraordinary team. If you're passionate about impact and innovation, we'd love to meet you!

About the Role

At Tandem Health, our mission is to fix healthcare by giving clinicians tools that work for them, not against them. In healthcare, everything runs on Windows. It’s where clinicians live, and it’s where we win. 

As our first Forward Deployed Windows Engineer, you’ll be at the heart of the action. You’ll work directly with our partners - clinics, hospitals, and healthcare systems - ensuring our software lands smoothly in every environment. You’ll own the deployment experience of our Windows application and implement deep, robust integrations with healthcare systems. You’ll be hands-on with systems that matter, working closely with engineers and clinicians to enable widespread deployment of Tandem. 


What you will do:

  • Own the deployment and support of our Windows-based application across diverse clinical environments. 

  • Build and maintain deep integrations with EHR systems in C#. 

  • Work closely with partner IT teams to ensure stable rollouts, diagnose gnarly system issues, and unblock adoption at speed. 

  • Craft tooling and processes allow deployments to scale reliably across Europe. 

  • Translate on-the-ground feedback into product and engineering improvements. 

  • Debug real-world environments where clinicians are depending on you for their day-to-day workflows. 

  • Be our subject matter expert on everything Windows - from OS internals to deployment strategies to third-party interoperability. 

What You Bring

  • Deep expertise in Windows development and deployment. You know your way around the registry, services, UAC, and installers. 

  • Strong programming skills in C# with experience building production systems in .NET. 

  • Experience integrating with EHR systems, healthcare APIs, or enterprise software in complex IT environments. 

  • A mindset of ownership: you want the thing to work, in the real world, for the real user. 

  • A love for solving real, gritty problems with elegant technical solutions. 

  • Excellent communication skills - you can talk to clinicians, IT admins, and engineers without missing a beat. 

Bonus Points

  • Hands-on experience building RPA solutions. You’ve written automations that interact with desktop applications and navigate complex UIs. 

  • Experience deploying and managing Windows applications in regulated or enterprise environments. 

  • Familiarity with audio management in Windows. 

  • Knowledge of common healthcare standards (e.g., HL7, FHIR). 

  • Exposure to security best practices in Windows environments. 

  • Past experience in customer-facing or field engineering roles. 

Location

We believe the best ideas happen when we’re together. This role is based in our vibrant HQ in the Epicenter building in the heart of Stockholm where you will work primarily from our office to collaborate, connect, and build our culture.


How to Apply

We adopt a continuous selection process, so please make sure to apply with your CV in English.

Our interview process consists of 4 stages:

  1. Screening interview with Talent Acquisition

  2. Technical interviews with some of our Engineers

  3. Interview with our CTO & Co-Founder

  4. Working Day - Join us in the Stockholm office for a day to experience our our culture firsthand, collaborate with our team, and see how you work in action.


Benefits

  • Competitive salary & company stock options

  • 25 days/year of paid vacation

  • 5,000 SEK wellness allowance (friskvårdsbidrag)

  • Social and team-building activities (off-sites, after works, winter/summer parties)

  • An opportunity to make a real positive impact in the world of healthcare

  • Work with some of the best minds in AI, healthcare, and engineering.

We review our benefits packages on a regular basis and might modify our benefits from time to time.

Culture at Tandem

At Tandem, we move fast, think big, and take ownership. We're a high-performing, diverse team with a shared drive to change the future of healthcare - and we’re just getting started.

Our culture is built on action, ambition, and learning. You'll be trusted to take the lead, challenge yourself, and make an impact from day one. We believe real growth happens when you're stretched, supported, and surrounded by smart, passionate teammates who want to win together.

Even though we’re spread across countries, we come together often in Sweden for team meetings, social events, and offsites - blending global reach with real human connection.

We hire for talent, potential, and attitude - valuing different backgrounds and fresh perspectives. Great ideas come from everywhere, and we’re building a team that reflects the world we want to change.

jobs.title: Staff Engineer - AI
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Build something monumental for Healthcare!

At Tandem Health we’re reimagining healthcare by putting clinicians first. Our platform - designed by clinicians, for clinicians - is built on deep insight into real-world pain points, with intuitive medical notes and workflows that truly support patient care.

We’re a fast-scaling health-tech company backed by top investors and expanding globally. We move fast, stay curious, and believe building something that matters starts with an extraordinary team. If you're passionate about impact and innovation, we'd love to meet you!

About the Role & You

You’re someone who loves experimenting with new tools and models and in your professional life you have an uncompromising standard for quality, something that has made you an expert in model evaluation and reliability. Your curiosity pushes you to understand systems end-to-end, but your true passion lies in perfecting the core algorithms that power everything. In previous roles, your goal has always been to deliver real value to users.

AI has the potential to transform healthcare, but getting there is no simple feat. Models can hallucinate, data is sensitive, and the stakes are incredibly high. Making AI reliable enough for healthcare is a generational challenge, and at Tandem Health we’re looking for someone to lead that charge for Europe’s healthcare systems.

At Tandem, you’ll lead the work of building the core AI algorithms that power our next-generation medical devices. This means setting up systems from the ground up, driving evaluation and iteration on models, and pushing innovation so that our products reach the level of quality healthcare can truly rely on.

This is a high-impact role where you’ll shape both the product and our engineering culture. If you’re excited by the challenge of building AI that actually works in healthcare - and leading the way there - we’d love to meet you.

What You Will Do

  • Lead the design and development of LLM-powered systems - from foundational model pipelines to APIs and user-facing applications that are critical to clinical workflows.

  • Pioneer advanced context engineering techniques to make models deeply aware of patient and domain-specific context, enabling safe and reliable outputs with no hallucinations.

  • Design and run rigorous evaluations to measure model quality, reliability, and performance, turning qualitative feedback into quantitative insights that drive iteration.

  • Build and deploy end-to-end AI applications, from data ingestion and preprocessing to production deployment and monitoring in clinical environments.

  • Set the technical direction for our AI efforts, leading and mentoring other talented engineers while fostering a culture of technical excellence, safety, and innovation.

What You Bring

  • A proven track record of leading or driving the implementation of advanced AI systems, from concept to production.

  • Deep experience building and deploying LLM-based systems at scale, including rolling out products to real users in production environments.

  • Strong communication skills, with the ability to clearly translate complex AI concepts to diverse audiences, from engineers to clinicians to executives.

  • A bias toward action, ownership, and proactivity. You raise the bar for everyone around you.

Bonus Points

  • Experience working with speech to text.

  • Experience building production data analytics and AB-testing.

  • Prior work in healthcare tech or regulated environments.

  • Deep understanding of clinical workflows, EHR systems, and medical documentation processes.

Location

We believe the best ideas happen when we’re together. This role is based in our vibrant HQ in the Epicenter building in the heart of Stockholm where you will work primarily from our office to collaborate, connect, and build our culture.

How to Apply

We adopt a continuous selection process, so please make sure to apply with your CV in English.

Our interview process consists of 4 stages:

  1. Screening interview with Talent Acquisition

  2. Shorter technical interview with one of senior engineers

  3. Follow up technical interview with some of our Engineering team

  4. First interview with our CTO & Co-Founder

  • 25 days/year of paid vacation

  • 5,000 SEK wellness allowance (friskvårdsbidrag)

  • Social and team-building activities (off-sites, after works, winter/summer parties)

  • An opportunity to make a real positive impact in the world of healthcare

  • Work with some of the best minds in AI, healthcare, and engineering.

We review our benefits packages on a regular basis and might modify our benefits from time to time.

Culture at Tandem

At Tandem, we move fast, think big, and take ownership. We're a high-performing, diverse team with a shared drive to change the future of healthcare - and we’re just getting started.

Our culture is built on action, ambition, and learning. You'll be trusted to take the lead, challenge yourself, and make an impact from day one. We believe real growth happens when you're stretched, supported, and surrounded by smart, passionate teammates who want to win together.

Even though we’re spread across countries, we come together often in Sweden for team meetings, social events, and offsites - blending global reach with real human connection.

jobs.descriptionPlain:
BUILD SOMETHING MONUMENTAL FOR HEALTHCARE!


At Tandem Health we’re reimagining healthcare by putting clinicians first. Our platform - designed by clinicians, for clinicians - is built on deep insight into real-world pain points, with intuitive medical notes and workflows that truly support patient care.

We’re a fast-scaling health-tech company backed by top investors and expanding globally. We move fast, stay curious, and believe building something that matters starts with an extraordinary team. If you're passionate about impact and innovation, we'd love to meet you!


ABOUT THE ROLE & YOU

You’re someone who loves experimenting with new tools and models and in your professional life you have an uncompromising standard for quality, something that has made you an expert in model evaluation and reliability. Your curiosity pushes you to understand systems end-to-end, but your true passion lies in perfecting the core algorithms that power everything. In previous roles, your goal has always been to deliver real value to users.

AI has the potential to transform healthcare, but getting there is no simple feat. Models can hallucinate, data is sensitive, and the stakes are incredibly high. Making AI reliable enough for healthcare is a generational challenge, and at Tandem Health we’re looking for someone to lead that charge for Europe’s healthcare systems.

At Tandem, you’ll lead the work of building the core AI algorithms that power our next-generation medical devices. This means setting up systems from the ground up, driving evaluation and iteration on models, and pushing innovation so that our products reach the level of quality healthcare can truly rely on.

This is a high-impact role where you’ll shape both the product and our engineering culture. If you’re excited by the challenge of building AI that actually works in healthcare - and leading the way there - we’d love to meet you.



WHAT YOU WILL DO

 - Lead the design and development of LLM-powered systems - from foundational model pipelines to APIs and user-facing applications that are critical to clinical workflows.

 - Pioneer advanced context engineering techniques to make models deeply aware of patient and domain-specific context, enabling safe and reliable outputs with no hallucinations.

 - Design and run rigorous evaluations to measure model quality, reliability, and performance, turning qualitative feedback into quantitative insights that drive iteration.

 - Build and deploy end-to-end AI applications, from data ingestion and preprocessing to production deployment and monitoring in clinical environments.

 - Set the technical direction for our AI efforts, leading and mentoring other talented engineers while fostering a culture of technical excellence, safety, and innovation.
   


WHAT YOU BRING

 - A proven track record of leading or driving the implementation of advanced AI systems, from concept to production.

 - Deep experience building and deploying LLM-based systems at scale, including rolling out products to real users in production environments.

 - Strong communication skills, with the ability to clearly translate complex AI concepts to diverse audiences, from engineers to clinicians to executives.

 - A bias toward action, ownership, and proactivity. You raise the bar for everyone around you.


BONUS POINTS

 - Experience working with speech to text.

 - Experience building production data analytics and AB-testing.

 - Prior work in healthcare tech or regulated environments.

 - Deep understanding of clinical workflows, EHR systems, and medical documentation processes.
   
   
   


LOCATION

We believe the best ideas happen when we’re together. This role is based in our vibrant HQ in the Epicenter building in the heart of Stockholm where you will work primarily from our office to collaborate, connect, and build our culture.


HOW TO APPLY

We adopt a continuous selection process, so please make sure to apply with your CV in English.

Our interview process consists of 4 stages:

 1. Screening interview with Talent Acquisition

 2. Shorter technical interview with one of senior engineers

 3. Follow up technical interview with some of our Engineering team

 4. First interview with our CTO & Co-Founder

 5. Working Day - Join us in the Stockholm office for a day to experience our culture firsthand, collaborate with our team, and see how you work in action.



BENEFITS

 - Competitive salary & company stock options

 - 25 days/year of paid vacation

 - 5,000 SEK wellness allowance (friskvårdsbidrag)

 - Social and team-building activities (off-sites, after works, winter/summer parties)

 - An opportunity to make a real positive impact in the world of healthcare

 - Work with some of the best minds in AI, healthcare, and engineering.

We review our benefits packages on a regular basis and might modify our benefits from time to time.


CULTURE AT TANDEM


At Tandem, we move fast, think big, and take ownership. We're a high-performing, diverse team with a shared drive to change the future of healthcare - and we’re just getting started.

Our culture is built on action, ambition, and learning. You'll be trusted to take the lead, challenge yourself, and make an impact from day one. We believe real growth happens when you're stretched, supported, and surrounded by smart, passionate teammates who want to win together.

Even though we’re spread across countries, we come together often in Sweden for team meetings, social events, and offsites - blending global reach with real human connection.

We hire for talent, potential, and attitude - valuing different backgrounds and fresh perspectives. Great ideas come from everywhere, and we’re building a team that reflects the world we want to change.

jobs.title: Country Director - Italy
jobs.descriptionHtml:

At Tandem Health we’re reimagining healthcare by putting clinicians first. Our platform - designed by clinicians, for clinicians - is built on deep insight into real-world pain points, with intuitive medical notes and workflows that truly support patient care.

We’re a fast-scaling health-tech company backed by top investors and expanding globally. We move fast, stay curious, and believe building something that matters starts with an extraordinary team. If you're passionate about impact and innovation, we'd love to meet you!

About the Role

At Tandem we’re reimagining how clinicians deliver care. As Country Manager for Italy, you’ll lead our market entry - shaping strategy, building partnerships, and bringing our clinician co-pilot to care providers across the country.

You'll work closely with our commercial and product teams to tailor Tandem for Italy's healthcare system, making a real difference in clinical workflows. As we grow, you’ll build and lead a local team to scale our impact quickly and sustainably

What you will do

  • Own the strategy and execution to launch and grow Tandem in Italy.

  • Build partnerships with providers, payors, and system suppliers (e.g., EHR vendors).

  • Work with our product team to localize Tandem’s solution for Italian clinicians.

  • Assemble and lead a high-performing local team as traction builds.

  • Champion the voice of the Italian market within Tandem.

What you bring

  • Extensive experience within healthcare, either clinical, commercial, or both.

  • A strong understanding of the Italian healthcare landscape.

  • Proven leadership and entrepreneurial drive - you know how to build from the ground up.

  • A collaborative mindset and passion for user-centered innovation.

  • Passion, resilience, and a deep commitment to improving healthcare.

Bonus Points

  • A strong network across Italy's healthcare sector.

  • Health-tech go-to-market experience.

  • Familiarity with Italian healthcare regulations.

  • Fluency in Italian and English.

Location

We believe the best ideas happen when we’re together. This is a full-time role based remotely in Milan. You’ll travel regularly - either to meet clinicians around Italy or to collaborate with our team in Stockholm.

We adopt a continuous selection process, so please make sure to apply with your CV in English.

jobs.title: Medical Operations - Netherlands
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Build something monumental for Healthcare!

At Tandem Health we’re reimagining healthcare by putting clinicians first. Our platform - designed by clinicians, for clinicians - is built on deep insight into real-world pain points, with intuitive medical notes and workflows that truly support patient care.

We’re a fast-scaling health-tech company backed by top investors and expanding globally. We move fast, stay curious, and believe building something that matters starts with an extraordinary team. If you're passionate about impact and innovation, we'd love to meet you!

About the Role

We’re building the clinical co-pilot of the future - empowering clinicians, enhancing care delivery, and scaling impact. As part of our Global Medical Operations team, you’ll play a pivotal role in rolling out Tandem’s AI clinical operating system to some of the most influential healthcare organisations worldwide.

This is a highly visible, global role where you’ll engage directly with executives, medical leaders, and end-users. You’ll bring clinical insight into how our tools are implemented on the ground - from onboarding new organisations and refining workflows to shaping the product through continuous feedback. You’ll be at the forefront of transforming healthcare delivery, ensuring Tandem becomes an indispensable part of daily patient care for clinicians across the globe.

What You Will Do

  • Lead live product demos for prospective clients and support global commercial efforts.

  • Design and adapt workflows and templates for diverse markets and large-scale customers.

  • Partner with product, engineering, and commercial teams to deliver smooth rollouts and seamless workflow integration.

  • Represent Tandem at international conferences, workshops, and customer events.

  • Guide clinicians through onboarding, training, and day-to-day support.

  • Troubleshoot and solve problems to ensure clinicians get maximum value from Tandem.

  • Build templates and prompts, contributing to the ongoing evolution of Tandem’s AI assistant.

  • Manage clinical safety incidents and optimise internal operations for safe scaling.


What You Bring

  • Clinical experience in healthcare (e.g. general practice, hospital, private practice).

  • Exposure to consulting, corporate, or startup environments.

  • A passion for technology, AI, and their potential to transform care.

  • Strong communication skills - equally comfortable with executives, engineers, and frontline clinicians.

  • Organisational strength and a process-driven mindset.

  • Ownership, curiosity, and initiative in a fast-paced environment.

  • Flexibility to travel up to 25% and step in during critical moments.

  • Multilingual skills (highly valued).

Bonus Points

  • Experience with prompting or large language models (LLMs).

  • Background in healthtech or SaaS.

  • Familiarity with EU clinical safety or digital health regulations.

  • Track record in implementation projects or customer rollouts.

Location

We believe great ideas thrive when we connect in person. This is a full-time remote role based in the Netherlands with occasional travel to meet the core team in Stockholm and clinicians across the country as needed

How to Apply

We adopt a continuous selection process, so please make sure to apply with your CV in English.

Our interview process consists of 4 stages:

  1. Screening interview with Talent Acquisition

  2. First interview with our Country Director

  3. Follow up interview with some of our Medical Operations team members

  4. Working Day - Join us in the Stockholm office for a day to experience our culture firsthand, collaborate with our team, and see how you work in action.

Culture at Tandem

At Tandem, we move fast, think big, and take ownership. We're a high-performing, diverse team with a shared drive to change the future of healthcare - and we’re just getting started.

Our culture is built on action, ambition, and learning. You'll be trusted to take the lead, challenge yourself, and make an impact from day one. We believe real growth happens when you're stretched, supported, and surrounded by smart, passionate teammates who want to win together.

Even though we’re spread across countries, we come together often in Sweden for team meetings, social events, and offsites - blending global reach with real human connection.

We hire for talent, potential, and attitude - valuing different backgrounds and fresh perspectives. Great ideas come from everywhere, and we’re building a team that reflects the world we want to change.

jobs.title: Staff Engineer - Audio
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Build something monumental for Healthcare!

At Tandem Health we’re reimagining healthcare by putting clinicians first. Our platform - designed by clinicians, for clinicians - is built on deep insight into real-world pain points, with intuitive medical notes and workflows that truly support patient care.

We’re a fast-scaling health-tech company backed by top investors and expanding globally. We move fast, stay curious, and believe building something that matters starts with an extraordinary team. If you're passionate about impact and innovation, we'd love to meet you!

About the Role & You

You’re relentlessly driven to understand how things work, the kind of person who dives deep when something breaks and won’t stop until you understand it and it’s fixed. You have applied this drive to understand the endlessly complex world of audio. A medium where edge-cases are the norm and any non standard processing requires a deep understanding..

You thrive in this complexity. You’ve built audio pipelines end-to-end and felt the real-world pain of making them work at scale, from managing flaky devices to handling buffering, mixing, streaming, and transcription. Where others see chaos, you see a system to be understood, stabilized, and made reliable.

At Tandem Health, you’ll lead the effort to build and scale our massive audio pipelines that power real-time healthcare conversations. From ensuring the right microphone is active to delivering accurate transcripts, you’ll make sure our audio systems are seamless, stable, and ready to scale across the continent.

This is a high-impact role where you’ll shape both our technical architecture and our engineering culture. If you’re excited by solving deeply technical problems in one of the most complex and rewarding mediums, we’d love to meet you.

What You Will Do

  • Lead the design, development, and scaling of our audio pipelines, enabling real-time streaming of healthcare conversations with high reliability.

  • Build systems that span the full chain, from device input and buffering to mixing, streaming, and transcription, ensuring accurate and timely delivery of audio data.

  • Ensure stability, performance, and scalability of our audio infrastructure as we scale to support healthcare organizations across Europe.

  • Collaborate across the stack, from frontend UX for audio-native products to backend processing systems and databases that handle high-volume streams.

  • Drive best practices in audio engineering, setting technical direction and standards while mentoring engineers working on audio-related systems.

  • Continuously improve our audio technology, iterating on tooling, monitoring, and evaluation to ensure high quality and reliability in production.

What You Bring

  • A proven track record of building and deploying large-scale audio pipelines in production environments.

  • Deep experience working across the full stack, from frontend applications to backend services and databases, with a focus on audio-heavy systems.

  • Hands-on experience building audio-native products, where audio is central to the user experience.

  • A deep curiosity for complex systems and a relentless drive to make them work - you go beyond surface fixes to understand what’s really happening under the hood.

  • A strong ability to design systems that remain stable, performant, and reliable at scale, even under real-world constraints and device variability.

  • Excellent collaboration and communication skills, with the ability to work closely with cross-functional teams to build robust, high-quality systems.

Bonus Points

  • Experience with speech-to-text and transcription systems in production environments.

  • Prior work in healthcare tech or regulated environments.

  • Deep understanding of clinical workflows, EHR systems, and medical documentation processes.

  • Experience with frontend development in JS and React.

  • Experience with Windows development in C#.

Location

We believe the best ideas happen when we’re together. This role is based in our vibrant HQ in the Epicenter building in the heart of Stockholm where you will work primarily from our office to collaborate, connect, and build our culture.

How to Apply

We adopt a continuous selection process, so please make sure to apply with your CV in English.

Our interview process consists of 4 stages:

  1. Screening interview with Talent Acquisition

  2. Shorter technical interview with one of senior engineers

  3. Follow up technical interview with some of our Engineering team

  4. First interview with our CTO & Co-Founder

  5. Working Day - Join us in the Stockholm office for a day to experience our culture firsthand, collaborate with our team, and see how you work in action.


Benefits

  • Competitive salary & company stock options

  • 25 days/year of paid vacation

  • 5,000 SEK wellness allowance (friskvårdsbidrag)

  • Social and team-building activities (off-sites, after works, winter/summer parties)

  • An opportunity to make a real positive impact in the world of healthcare

  • Work with some of the best minds in AI, healthcare, and engineering.

We review our benefits packages on a regular basis and might modify our benefits from time to time.

Culture at Tandem

At Tandem, we move fast, think big, and take ownership. We're a high-performing, diverse team with a shared drive to change the future of healthcare - and we’re just getting started.

Our culture is built on action, ambition, and learning. You'll be trusted to take the lead, challenge yourself, and make an impact from day one. We believe real growth happens when you're stretched, supported, and surrounded by smart, passionate teammates who want to win together.

Even though we’re spread across countries, we come together often in Sweden for team meetings, social events, and offsites - blending global reach with real human connection.

We hire for talent, potential, and attitude - valuing different backgrounds and fresh perspectives. Great ideas come from everywhere, and we’re building a team that reflects the world we want to change.
